sub_title: Director of Max Value. Interim Management, Training and Consultancy for a Sustainable Economy
summary:
Edwin Koster is the director of Max Value. Max Value provides interim management services, consultancy and training for a sustainable economy. Max Value worked with a large variety of organizations which include the United Nations, ASN Bank, Dutch Social Economic Council (SER), Tommy Hilfiger, Netherlands Enterprise Agency (RVO), Karl Lagerfeld, Social Accountability International (SAI), International Finance Corporation (IFC), Solidaridad, Pré Consultants, Gucci Group, Rijkswaterstaat, C&A, INretail, Better Cotton Initiative, Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Chinese Ministry of Agriculture, Fairtrade International (FLO), Rijksvastgoedbedrijf, PIANOo and WWF.
  
While working for Solidaridad and Made-By, Edwin managed projects on sustainable agriculture, clean production and labour rights in China, India and Africa. He represented Solidaridad in the Advisory Board of Social Accountability International in New York and the Stakeholder Board of the Business Social Compliance Initiative (BSCI) in Brussels. Before working in the area of sustainability, Edwin worked as a buyer and buying manager of several fashion retailers. 

Edwin Koster was born in the Netherlands and lives in Amsterdam. He holds a Masters in Sociology for the University of Amsterdam and a Bachelor degree in Textile Engineering and Business Administration from the Higher Technical College in Enschede. 

Specialties: Consultancy, training, project and interim management on Responsible Business Conduct and sustainable supply chain management. Know-how and experience on: business and human rights, due diligence, sustainable strategy development, sustainable procurement, grievance mechanisms, living wage, health and safety, certification and standard setting, sustainable agriculture incl. organic and Fairtrade, sustainable apparel and electronics.

profile_positions.description:
Interim and project management, consultancy and training, for a Sustainable Economy.

Current and completed projects include:

Interim Senior Manager Sustainable Raw Materials at PVH

Several interim management positions at the Responsible Business Conduct department at the SER (Dutch Social and Economic Council)

Advice to Rijkswaterstaat on responsible procurement of ICT (Circular & Fair ICT Pact)

Advice to Rijksvastgoedbedrijf on responsible procurement of solar panels

Implementation of a Learning Agenda for FVO. Topics on the agenda include: responsible buying practices, supply chain transparency and grievance mechanisms

Development of Assessment Frameworks for the Agreements on Sustainable Fashion/Textiles (AGT) and Natural Stone (TruStone) for the SER
 
Organization and moderation of a series of webinars on Responsible Business Conduct (RBC) in Sri Lanka, with a focus on the agro-food, tourism and apparel sector. In collaboration with the Dutch embassy in Sri Lanka, RVO and CSR Sri Lanka

Development of sustainability strategy at Karl Lagerfeld
 
Development of guidance on how to strengthen workers' voice in multi-stakeholder initiatives for the UN Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights

Interim CEO of MADE-BY, a non-profit consultancy with offices in Londen and Amsterdam

Project Management of Supply Chain Evolution Program at PVH

Interim CSR manager at INretail

Management of Tommy Hilfiger Water Stewardship Program in Asia 

Hands-on CSR-support for Red Button and Ten Cate

Training and research on Living Wages for ASN Bank, Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Solidaridad and RVO

Due Diligence Master Classes for the apparel industry  

Development and delivery of Sustainable Retail Training for Inretail and Dutch Ministry of I&M  

The consultation of stakeholders and set-up of pilot projects in China for the Better Cotton Initiative 

Development of guidelines for certification of small farmers in relation to the biomass sector for RVO
